qas.question: What does Greece lag behind other EU countries in terms of use?

context: Greece has tended to lag behind its European Union partners in terms of <a0_0><b5_0>Internet<b5_0/><a0_0/> use, with the gap closing rapidly in recent years. The percentage of households with access to the Internet <a1_0><b6_0>more than doubled<b6_0/><a1_0/> between 2006 and 2013, from 23% to 56% respectively (compared with an EU average of 49% and 79%). At the same time, there has been a massive increase in the proportion of households with <a2_0><b7_0>a broadband connection<b7_0/><a2_0/>, from 4% in 2006 to 55% in 2013 (compared with an EU average of 30% and 76%). However, <a3_0><b8_0>Greece<b8_0/><a3_0/> also has the EU's third highest percentage of people who have never used the Internet: <a4_0><b9_0>36%<b9_0/><a4_0/> in 2013, down from 65% in 2006 (compared with an EU average of 21% and 42%).
